es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential
Class TimeDrivenActivity

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.SimulationObject
      es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.VariableStoreSimulationObject
          es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.TimeStampedSimulationObject
              es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.Activity
                  es.ull.isaatc.simulation.sequential.TimeDrivenActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activity, Debuggable, Describable, Identifiable, SimulationObject, TimeDrivenActivity, VariableStore, VariableStoreSimulationObject, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
public class TimeDrivenActivity
extends Activity
implements TimeDrivenActivity

A task which could be carried out by an element in a specified time. This kind of activities can be characterized by a priority value, presentiality, interruptibility, and a set of workgropus. Each workgroup represents a combination of resource types required for carrying out the activity, and the duration of the activity when performed with this workgroup.

By default, time-driven activities are presential, that is, an element carrying out this activity can't perform simultaneously any other presential activity; and ininterruptible, i.e., once started, the activity keeps its resources until it's finished, even if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed. This two characteristics are customizable by means of the Modifier enum type. An activity can be NONPRESENTIAL, when the element can perform other activities while it's performing this one; and INTERRUPTIBLE, when the activity can be interrupted, and later continued, if the resources become unavailable while the activity is being performed.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

isFeasible

protected java.util.ArrayDeque<Resource> isFeasible(WorkItem wi)
Description copied from class: Activity
Checks if this activity can be performed with any of its workgroups. Firstly checks if the activity is not potentially feasible, then goes through the workgroups looking for an appropriate one. If the activity can't be performed with any of the workgroups it's marked as not potentially feasible.

Overrides:
isFeasible in class Activity
Parameters:
wi - Work Item wanting to perform the activity
Returns:
The set of resources which compound the solution. Null if there are not enough resources to carry out the activity by using this workgroup.

validElement

public boolean validElement(WorkItem wItem)
An element is valid to perform a time-driven activity is it's not currently carrying out another activity or this activity is non presential.

request

public void request(WorkItem wItem)
Description copied from class: Activity
Requests this activity. Checks if this activity is feasible by the specified work item. If the activity is feasible, carryOut is called; in other case, the work item is added to this activity's queue.

Specified by:
request in class Activity
Parameters:
wItem - Work Item requesting this activity.
